channel.title: Comments on: A small tip for upgrading your XPages apps from 8.5.1 to 8.5.2

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>John,</p><p>I've not done any significant testing yet but I suspect we should leave the responseComplete line in.</p><p>With regards any potential memory leaks, again I've not looked in detail but I suspect it will be OK.</p><p>Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
John,

I've not done any significant testing yet but I suspect we should leave the responseComplete line in.

With regards any potential memory leaks, again I've not looked in detail but I suspect it will be OK.

Matt

item.title: By: John Vaughan
item.dc:creator: John Vaughan
item.description: <p>So we should get rid of facesContext.responseComplete(); in 8.5.2?</p><p>Do you have any idea if leaving that line out in 8.5.1 will cause memory leaks?</p>
item.content:encoded:
So we should get rid of facesContext.responseComplete(); in 8.5.2?

Do you have any idea if leaving that line out in 8.5.1 will cause memory leaks?

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>@John, You're right, Stephan's codesample does use the responseComplete() argument. From my testing this is still an issue though.</p><p>Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
@John, You're right, Stephan's codesample does use the responseComplete() argument. From my testing this is still an issue though.

Matt

item.title: By: John Vaughan
item.dc:creator: John Vaughan
item.description: <p>The code I gratefully stole out of the LS2010 AD111 session (Tim and Stephan's session on this topic) ends with:</p><p>facesContext.responseComplete();</p><p>Any problems with that line in 8.5.2?</p>
item.content:encoded:
The code I gratefully stole out of the LS2010 AD111 session (Tim and Stephan's session on this topic) ends with:

facesContext.responseComplete();

Any problems with that line in 8.5.2?
